trans-unit.source: How to Use VMAccess for Linux Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: How to Use VMAccess for Linux Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: How to use the Azure Preview Portal or the VMAccess extension for Linux to reset passwords and SSH keys, to reset SSH configurations, and delete Linux users.
trans-unit.target: How to use the Azure Preview Portal or the VMAccess extension for Linux to reset passwords and SSH keys, to reset SSH configurations, and delete Linux users.

trans-unit.source: How to Reset a Password or SSH for Linux Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: How to Reset a Password or SSH for Linux Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: If you can't connect to a Linux virtual machine because of a forgotten password, an incorrect Secure Shell (SSH) key, or a problem with the SSH configuration, use the Azure Preview Portal or the VMAccessForLinux extension to reset the password or SSH key or fix the SSH configuration.
trans-unit.target: If you can't connect to a Linux virtual machine because of a forgotten password, an incorrect Secure Shell (SSH) key, or a problem with the SSH configuration, use the Azure Preview Portal or the VMAccessForLinux extension to reset the password or SSH key or fix the SSH configuration.

trans-unit.source: Note that this article applies to the virtual machines created using the **Classic** deployment model.
trans-unit.target: Note that this article applies to the virtual machines created using the **Classic** deployment model.

trans-unit.source: Reset the SSH configuration
trans-unit.target: Reset the SSH configuration

trans-unit.source: If the SSH configuration is in an undesired state, you might also lose access to the VM.
trans-unit.target: If the SSH configuration is in an undesired state, you might also lose access to the VM.

trans-unit.source: You can use the VMAccess extension to reset the configuration to its default state.
trans-unit.target: You can use the VMAccess extension to reset the configuration to its default state.

trans-unit.source: To do so, you just need to set the “reset_ssh” key to “True”.
trans-unit.target: To do so, you just need to set the “reset_ssh” key to “True”.

trans-unit.source: The extension will restart the SSH server, open the SSH port on your VM, and reset the SSH configuration to default values.
trans-unit.target: The extension will restart the SSH server, open the SSH port on your VM, and reset the SSH configuration to default values.

trans-unit.source: The user account (name, password or SSH keys) will not be changed.
trans-unit.target: The user account (name, password or SSH keys) will not be changed.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The SSH configuration file that gets reset is located at /etc/ssh/sshd_config.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The SSH configuration file that gets reset is located at /etc/ssh/sshd_config.
